cw4

Class ContactManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • cw4.ContactManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContactManager, ContactManagerPlus, java.io.Serializable

    public class ContactManagerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContactManagerPlus
    Class to Manage contacts and Meetings
    Since:
    24 February 2015
    Author:
    Oliver Smart <osmart01@dcs.bbk.ac.uk>
    See Also:
    ContactManager, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Contact> contacts
      list of Contact 's that have been registered using addNewContact.
      private FileSaveRetrieve fileSR
      deals with saving state, fileName, the method, and the methods to do it
      private java.util.List<FutureMeeting> futureMeetings
      list of future meetings that have been added using addFutureMeetings.
      private java.util.List<PastMeeting> pastMeetings
      list of pastMeetings created by addMeetingNotes on a FutureMeeting or by addNewPastMeeting.
      private java.util.Calendar pretendNow
      Normally the real system date time will be used to check whether a meeting is in the future or past.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      Needed for Serializable to throw an error if decoding a previous incompatible version.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        Needed for Serializable to throw an error if decoding a previous incompatible version. Need to increment if this class is changed so it is not backwards compatible with its previous version.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • contacts

        private java.util.List<Contact> contacts
        list of Contact 's that have been registered using addNewContact.

      • futureMeetings

        private java.util.List<FutureMeeting> futureMeetings
        list of future meetings that have been added using addFutureMeetings.

      • pastMeetings

        private java.util.List<PastMeeting> pastMeetings
        list of pastMeetings created by addMeetingNotes on a FutureMeeting or by addNewPastMeeting.

      • pretendNow

        private java.util.Calendar pretendNow
        Normally the real system date time will be used to check whether a meeting is in the future or past. However if pretendNow is not null then this date time will be used instead. Intended for testing.

      • fileSR

        private FileSaveRetrieve fileSR
        deals with saving state, fileName, the method, and the methods to do it

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContactManagerImpl

        public ContactManagerImpl()
        construct a brand new ContactManager with no attempt to read from a save state file. Call to flush() will save state to the default filename "contacts.txt" using SERIALIZATION method. Use another constructor to override defaults.

      • ContactManagerImpl

        public ContactManagerImpl(java.lang.String fileName)
        Construct the contact manager with data from a SERIALIZATION save-state-file. N.B. this file will normally be overwritten when flush() method is later called to save the state. Note that the retrieved file name got from the save-state-file is ignored and the argument fileName will be used.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the save-state-file name
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - - if there is a problem in opening the file, reading from it or decoding the object

      • ContactManagerImpl

        public ContactManagerImpl(java.lang.String fileName,
                          FileSaveRetrieveMethod fSRMethod)
        Construct the contact manager with data from a save-state-file. N.B. this file will normally be overwritten when flush() method is later called to save the state. Note that the retrieved file name got from the file is ignored and the argument fileName will be used instead.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the save-state-file name
        fSRMethod - the method used to create the save-state-file

      • addFutureMeeting

        public int addFutureMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                            java.util.Calendar date)
        "Add a new meeting to be held in the future."
        Specified by:
        addFutureMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of contacts that will participate in the meeting
        date - the date on which the meeting will take place
        Returns:
        the ID for the meeting
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting is set for a time in the past, or if any contact is not in list of current contacts

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
        "Returns the list of future meetings scheduled with this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates."
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the user’s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
        "Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates. Additional specification from Moodle cw4 discussion forum: SERGIO GUTIERREZ-SANTOS 15 December 2014, 5:23 PM "The method must return also past meetings if it is called with a past date as parameter. The name is confusing, a better name would have been getMeetingList(Calendar) or even getMeetingListOn(Calendar). We apologise for the confusion.""
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the list of meetings

      • getPastMeetingList

        public java.util.List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingList(Contact contact)
        "Returns the list of past meetings in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates."
        Specified by:
        getPastMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the user’s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of past meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

      • addNewPastMeeting

        public void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                              java.util.Calendar date,
                              java.lang.String text)
        "Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past."
        Specified by:
        addNewPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of participants
        date - the date on which the meeting took place
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the list of contacts is empty, or any of the contacts does not exist
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if meeting is set for the future (N.B. this is missing from Interface specification but needs to be done for consistency).

      • addMeetingNotes

        public void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                            java.lang.String text)
        "Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes). It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date." N.B. if used to add notes to a past meeting, the new notes replace the existing ones (rather than being appended).
        Specified by:
        addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the meeting
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting does not exist
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the meeting is set for a date in the future
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the notes are null

      • addNewContact

        public void addNewContact(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String notes)
        "Create a new contact with the specified name and notes."
        Specified by:
        addNewContact in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the contact.
        notes - notes to be added about the contact.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if identical contact ID error occurs (this should be an "impossible error")

      • flush

        public void flush()
        "Save all data to disk. This method must be executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it." Note that the file name and method to be saved are set in whatever constructor was used and at present cannot be altered.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface ContactManager
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - - if there is an error in encoding the contactManager or in opening the file or writing to it.

        Specified by:

        public void overrideDateNow(java.util.Calendar pretendNow)

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the date/time to treat as "now" or null if no pretend is set (so real system time will be used).

      • checkDateIsFuture

        private boolean checkDateIsFuture(java.util.Calendar date)
        check whether a date is in the future N.B. checks against current date/time unless overrideDateNow has been used to set a "pretendNow"
        Parameters:
        date - the date to check
        Returns:
        whether the date is in the future.

      • checkContacts

        private void checkContacts(Contact... checkContacts)
        Checks the contacts are all recognised and appear in stored contacts
        Parameters:
        checkContacts - the single contact or array of contacts to be checked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the contacts does not appear, is supplied as a clone or if the contact array is empty.

      • getPastMeetingNoThrow

        private PastMeeting getPastMeetingNoThrow(int id)
        Returns the PAST meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none. Like getPastMeeting except does not throw an exception if supplied with id of future meeting.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the meeting
        Returns:
        the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.

      • getFutureMeetingNoThrow

        private FutureMeeting getFutureMeetingNoThrow(int id)
        Returns the FUTURE meeting with the requested ID, or null if there is none. Like getFutureMeeting except that does not throw exception if supplied with id of a past meeting.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the meeting
        Returns:
        the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.
